column3:
The `test/lint/` move is an obvious utACK, but the "add readme" part is troublesome:

The following addition â€¦ 

```
This folder contains lint scripts that aim to prevent direct or indirect user facing bugs.
Patches that do not pass the linter checks are usually not accepted.

Note that the [recommended style](/doc/developer-notes.md) and other stylistic
inconsistencies should no

@practicalswift That was my first draft, but I realized that the style guide includes not only enforceable guidelines, but also a bunch of recommendations, that are fine to violate. For example the "Miscellaneous" [coding style](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#coding-style) or the reference to the clang-format rules. While most of them can be reliably identifi

Also note that the wording is not strict "[...] other stylistic inconsistencies *should* not be enforced [...]"\n\nWe can always add a linter for stuff that is uncontroversial but not preventing any user facing bugs. See for example the linter that checks for trailing white space.
`test/liny/lint-python.sh` also catches python scripts in contrib/ and share/ - fine I guess?
@promag I guess that is fine or maybe even desired.

Conecpt ACK moving the linters to `test/lint`. No need IMO to bundle that change with a new readme setting a policy about what should be linted.\n\nIf you want to change the linter policy, then it seems appropriate to raise it in a meeting. For this PR, I recommend you limit it to just moving the files.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fa3c910bfeab00703c947c5200a64c21225b50ef , modulo Empact's comment about the `check-doc` documentation.
I'm just going to merge this, so many utACKs for the current state.
